sen.j: 外様大名（とざまだいみょう）は江戸時代の大名出自による分類の一。
sen.e: Tozama daimyo was a class of daimyo in Edo period defined according to ancestry.

sen.j: 「外様」とは、もともとは主家とゆるい主従関係を持った家臣をさす。
sen.e: The term 'tozama' originally indicated a vassal whose relationship with the lord was not tight.
sen.cmt: 「ゆるい」主従関係の「ゆるい」とは、「主従関係が密接でない」と解釈しました。

sen.j: 主家の家政には係わらず、軍事動員などにだけ応じる場合が多い。
sen.e: Tozama daimyo were not involved in the household management within their master's house, and responded instead to the master upon notification of military mobilization or the like.

sen.j: 主家滅亡時に主家から離反しても非難を受けることは無い。
sen.e: Tozama daimyo could irreproachably secede from vassalage after the fall of the master's house.
sen.cmt: 「主家滅亡時」の「時」は、内容的には「後」と解釈して訳しました。

sen.j: 外様大名とは、関ヶ原の戦い前後に徳川氏の支配体系に組み込まれた大名を指す。
sen.e: Tozama daimyo were daimyo who were incorporated into the ruling system of the TOKUGAWA clan before and after the Battle of Sekigahara.

sen.j: 大領を治める大名も多いが、基本的に江戸を中心とする関東や京都・大阪・東海道沿い等の戦略的な要地の近くには置かれなかった。
sen.e: Many of tozama daimyo ruled dairyo (the highest rank of district officials called gunji), but they were basically not stationed in the vicinity of the locations of strategic importance including Kanto region with Edo in the center, Kyoto, Osaka and those along the Tokaido Road.

sen.e: Many of tozama daimyo ruled large domains, however, they were basically not stationed in the vicinity of the locations of strategic importance including Kanto region with Edo in the center, Kyoto, Osaka and those along the Tokaido Road.

sen.j: 江戸時代の初期には江戸幕府に警戒され些細な不備を咎められ改易される大名も多かった。
sen.e: In the early Edo period the Edo bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) was wary of tozama daimyo, and condemned them for minor deficiencies, which often resulted in sanction called kaieki: sudden dismissal and deprivation of position, privileges and properties.
sen.cmt: 「改易」 kaieki 的確な訳がありませんが、下記参照のうえ訳出してみました。 http://books.google.co.jp/books?id=p2QnPijAEmEC&pg=PA449&dq=kaieki,+Edo&as_brr=3&cd=3#v=onepage&q=kaieki%2C%20Edo&f=false 左記Japan Encyclopediaの定義が最も正確のようですが長いです。
sen.e: In the early Edo period, the Edo bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) was wary of tozama daimyo, and condemned them for minor deficiencies, which often resulted in sanction called kaieki: sudden dismissal and deprivation of position, privileges and properties.

In the early Edo period, the Edo bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) was wary of tozama daimyo, and condemned them for minor deficiencies, which often resulted in sanction called kaieki: sudden dismissal and deprivation of position, privileges and properties.

sen.j: 外様大名は一般に老中などの幕閣の要職には就けないとされていたが、対馬国の宗氏は伝統的に朝鮮との外交に重きを成し、また江戸後期になると真田氏、松前氏のように要職へ就く外様大名も現れた。
sen.e: Tozama daimyo were generally not appointed to key positions among the cabinet officials of the shogunate such as roju, apart from some exceptions including the SO clan of Tsushimanokuni province, who had traditionally played a significant role in diplomatic relations with Korea, and the SANADA and MATSUMAE clans, who were appointed key positions in the late Edo period.

sen.j: また、藤堂氏は徳川氏の先鋒とされ軍事的には譜代筆頭の井伊氏と同格であり、池田輝政は親藩と同格とされ大坂の役の総大将を勤める予定だったといわれる。
sen.e: The other such exceptional tozama daimyo included the TODO clan, who served as the TOKUGAWA clan's spearhead and was, in the military, ranked as high as the II clan of the Fudai Hitto (Principal fudai daimyo), and Terumasa IKEDA was ranked as high as shinpan (TOKUGAWA relatives) and was once expected to serve as the Commander-in-Chief in the Sieges of Ozaka.

sen.j: また、同じ外様大名でも比較的早い時期から徳川家と友好関係があった池田氏・黒田氏・細川氏などと関ヶ原の戦い後に臣従した毛利氏・島津氏・上杉氏などでは扱いが違ったとの説もある。
sen.e: In addition, there is a theory that the TOKUGAWA shogunate distinguished between pre-Sekigahara tozama daimyo such as IKEDA, KURODA and HOSOKAWA clans who had maintained close relationship with TOKUGAWA clan well before, and post-Sekigahara tozama daimyo such as MORI, SHIMAZU and UESUGI clans who had submitted themselves to the TOKUGAWA clan's rule after the Battle of Sekigahara, so as to treat the two parties differently.
sen.cmt: 「関ヶ原の戦い後に臣従した」大名をpost-Sekigahara tozama daimyoとしたのに合わせ、池田氏ら「比較的早い時期から」の外様大名をpre-Sekigahara tozama daimyoと補足しました。

sen.j: なお、血縁関係や功績などにより譜代に準ずる扱いを受けている外様大名について、便宜的に準譜代大名と呼ぶこともある。
sen.e: Incidentally, some tozama daimyo, who were the TOKUGAWA clan's blood relatives or persons of high achievement, were treated as equally well as fudai daimyo, and were also conveniently called jun-fudai daimyo (quasi fudai daimyo).
